result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Charles D Ott Jr was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 1 day jail credit if probation is revoked

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay all court costs, supervision fees and any costs of treatment as a condition of probation.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

Defendant to pay all court costs, supervision fees and any costs of treatment as a condition of probation.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
Court orders absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants.
Defendant to submit to random testing.
Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08

Conditions set by court:  Court orders absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. SCRAM within same date as posting bail.

Defendant Charles D Ott Jr in court with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Defendant in custody. Patti L. Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appears by video conferencing from Ozaukee County Jail.  Public defender counsel appears with defendant as friend of the court, for purpose of bail hearing only at this time.  Defendant requests adjournment  to retain counsel.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing on felony complaint.  Court orders adjournment, allowing time for defendant to decide whether preliminary hearing will be requested.  Status conference scheduled for April 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.
